Name: Model Boat with Green and White Cabin
Description: Models of boats with various forms and functions were placed in the tomb for travel in the afterlife. The model boat has a pointed bow and stern. It has a relatively small cabin painted green and white, in which the owner is shown seated. The boat has 15 male figures working as the crew. One uses poles to guide the ship, another holds the steering oar, and two are seated on each side of the cabin. Four members of the crew are standing in two rows in front of five others that were standing behind the mast, which is now missing. All figures are painted red and have shaven heads. They are wearing white kilts that vary in length.
